intro: Habranthus hesperius, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to drought conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
